author: BBC News
description:
A United Nations commission of inquiry has said that Israel has committed genocide against Palestinians in Gaza.

A new report says there are reasonable grounds to conclude that four of the five genocidal acts defined under international law have been carried out since the start of the war with Hamas in 2023. Israel's foreign ministry said it categorically rejected the report, denouncing it as "distorted and false". Adam is joined by John Simpson - BBC World Affairs Editor and Presenter of Unspun World.

And, an emergency debate has been held in the House of Commons into the appointment of Lord Mandelson as the UK Ambassador to the US. Adam, Chris and Alex discuss that and whether we are about to see a change of messaging from number 10 to ahead of the party conference.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews #Israel #Gaza #Trump
title: Israel accused of genocide in Gaza by UN commission | BBC Newscast

author: BBC News
description:
US President Donald Trump and his wife Melania landed at London Stansted Airport on Tuesday evening, for an unprecedented second state visit to the UK. 

After disembarking Air Force One, the president and first lady were greeted by the US Chief of Protocol, Ambassador Monica Crowley, and also by the Viscount Hood, Lord-in-Waiting, on behalf of the King.

Overnight they will be staying at Winfield House in Regent's Park, the home of the US ambassador to the UK.

The main events of the visit will not begin until Wednesday once the president and first lady are formally welcomed by the King and Queen at Windsor Castle.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#US #UK #BBCNews
title: US President Donald Trump and wife Melania land in UK for historic second state visit | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: US President Donald Trump lands in UK for historic second state visit. #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
"One-by-one we were cuffed at the wrists and chained at the waist."
 
One of the Hyundai workers arrested by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents has spoken to the BBC about what he and his colleagues faced during and after the raid at an electric vehicle battery plant in Georgia.
 
The South Korean government has said it is investigating potential human rights violations during the raid and detention of Korean workers by US authorities.
 
More than 300 South Korean workers returned home on Friday after being held for a week. The BBC has contacted the US ICE for comment.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Hyundai #SouthKorea #US #BBCNews
title: South Korean detained in US Hyundai factory raid speaks to BBC | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Warning: Contains distressing scenes.
 
The BBC has heard devastating accounts of Afghan mothers and babies dying after hundreds of US-backed clinics shut following drastic overseas aid cuts. 
 
The Trump administration has justified withdrawing aid over “longstanding concerns that funding was benefiting terrorist groups, including... the Taliban”, who govern the country.
 
The Taliban government denies that aid money was going into their hands.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Afghanistan #USAID #BBCNews
title: 'My wife and child died after Donald Trump cut US aid for our clinic' | BBC News

Tyler Robinson has been charged with seven offences relating to the killing of conservative influencer Charlie Kirk - and the Utah attorney general will seek death penalty.
 
The 22-year-old faces seven charges, including aggravated murder.

author: BBC News
description:
US President Donald Trump has established a DC-style National Guard task force to take on crime in Memphis, Tennessee.
 
The Democratic-led city is the second to face a Trump administration crackdown on crime, following Washington DC.
 
Trump has vowed to "fix" the city after shelving plans for a similar operation in Chicago, reportedly due to opposition from local and state officials.
 
Memphis' mayor Paul Young has voiced opposition to the plan, arguing that crime is already falling without federal intervention.
 
The president said on Monday, however, that Memphis is "overrun" with carjackings, robberies and shootings, as well as other crimes.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Memphis #DonaldTrump #BBCNews
title: Donald Trump to deploy National Guard to Memphis, Tennessee | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Washington has reached a "framework" deal with China on TikTok's US operations, paving the way for American ownership, as the world's two biggest economies negotiate a trade deal.
 
The deadline for a sale has since been extended three times already and the latest delay is due to end on 17 September.
 
The BBC's US partner CBS reported late on Monday that Oracle was among a group of firms that would enable TikTok operations to continue in the US if a deal between Washington and Beijing is finalised.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#TikTok #US #China #BBCNews
title: 'Framework' for American ownership of TikTok in US agreed with China, says Washington | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Heavy security will be in place across London and in Windsor ahead of US President Donald Trump's arrival in the UK for his state visit.
 
It will be the second time Donald Trump has been on a state visit to the UK, with the last time being in 2019.
 
Security has been ramped up for the president's arrival compared to other state visits, with protests planned against his visit.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news

#DonaldTrump #UK #StateVisit #BBCNews
title: Heavy security in UK ahead of Donald Trump state visit | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Hollywood icon Robert Redford has died aged 89.
 
The retired actor turned director starred in movies like Butch Cassidy And The Sundance Kid and All The President's Men.
 
Redford founded the Sundance Film Festival, which has taken place annually in Utah, US, since 1978.
 
Robert Redford's publicist Cindi Berger says the actor died earlier today at his home "at Sundance in the mountains of Utah - the place he loved, surrounded by those he loved."
 
"He will be missed greatly," Berger says, adding that the family are requesting privacy.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#RobertRedford #Hollywood #BBCNews
title: Robert Redford, Hollywood actor and director, dies aged 89 | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Google's owner Alphabet has announced a £5bn ($6.8bn) investment in UK artificial intelligence.
 
The money will be used for infrastructure and scientific research over the next two years - the first of several massive US investments being unveiled ahead of US President Donald Trump's state visit.
 
Google's president and chief investment officer Ruth Porat told BBC News in an exclusive interview there were "profound opportunities in the UK" for its "pioneering work in advanced science".
 
The company will officially open a $1bn (£735m) data centre in Waltham Cross, Hertfordshire, with Chancellor Rachel Reeves on Tuesday.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Google #AI #BBCNews
title: Google owner reveals £5bn AI investment in UK ahead of Donald Trump's state visit | BBC News

title: Nigerian chef breaks world record for largest jollof rice dish. #GuinnessWorldRecord #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
A United Nations commission of inquiry says Israel has committed genocide against Palestinians in Gaza.
 
A new report says there are reasonable grounds to conclude that four of the five genocidal acts defined under international law have been carried out since the start of the war with Hamas in 2023: killing members of a group, causing them serious bodily and mental harm, deliberately inflicting conditions calculated to destroy the group, and preventing births.
 
Israel's foreign ministry said it categorically rejected the report, denouncing it as "distorted and false".
 
An Israeli spokesperson accused the three experts on the UN commission of serving as "Hamas proxies" and relying "entirely on Hamas falsehoods, laundered and repeated by others" that had "already been thoroughly debunked".

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news

#Israel #Gaza #BBCNews
title: Israel has committed genocide in Gaza, says UN commission of inquiry | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Every year, BBC Radio 5 Live and Bitesize bring together a live audience of teenagers to discuss the issues that are shaping their lives, hosted by Nicky Campbell. 

We’ll also hear the results of an online survey of two-thousand 13 to 18 year olds from all over the UK.

This year the Teen summit is in Bradford - the UK City of Culture and one of the UK's youngest cities, with nearly 28% of its population aged under 20 - and we’ll be talking about using AI for homework, conspiracy theories, screen time, and much more. 

You can listen on Radio 5 live and watch on the BBC iPlayer from 9am to 11am or follow on the BBC News webSubscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news

#BBCNews
title: How does Gen Z and Gen Alpha feel about the future? | BBC News
